metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11745 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When encrypting with a block cipher, if a call to NSC_EncryptUpdate was made with data smaller than the block size, a small out of bounds write could occur. This could have caused heap corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, Firefox ESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
nss package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
